title: Helium leak delays Starliner crewed test flight
summary: The launch of Boeing’s CST-100 Starliner spacecraft on its first crewed flight has slipped at least four days because of a helium leak in the spacecraft.

title: China Continues Growth of ILRS Project
summary: On Friday, May 10 2024, Serbia became the most recent partner on China’s International Lunar Research Station, a multinational effort to support permanent science and research at the lunar South Pole. This project, consisting of China, Russia and several other smaller nations, has arisen largely in response to the United States-led Artemis Accords, a 39 nation coalition acting in support of the ongoing Moon to Mars program. With this announcement, it is abundantly clear that China is not slowing its rapid expansion of their own coalition, presenting the opposing Artemis Coalition with a second highly skilled group of players on the lunar surface.

title: Beyond blueprints: DoD’s commercial space strategy leaves industry wanting more
summary: The recent release of Defense Department and Space Force strategic blueprints for the use of commercial space technologies has been met with cautious optimism by the industry.

title: Intuitive Machines making upgrades to second lunar lander
summary: Intuitive Machines says it has identified several changes it will make to its Nova-C lunar lander ahead of its second mission late this year.
